Author: eattillithurts
Text: I dont think that weight gain is nessecary in recovery. For me recovery is finally stopping the anxiety. Finally eating normal. Finally not obsessing the whole day about your food and meals. Finally accepting a dinner invite without knowing what you will eat and without fasting 3 days prior.    But, not gaining like crazy. Recovery is learning to know how much to each without losing or gaining. Just learning what your body needs to stay in a healthy BMI range, may it be 18-20 or 22-24, doesnt matter. Just stopping to obsess

Author: BladderPatrol
Text: I think it’s slowly eating more, not whatever you want. It’s a gradual increase in food so your body slowly adjusts to hunger levels and the ‘weight gain’ anxiety that’s directly tied to bloat and waste accumulation. Eating at or a little below maintenance to accommodate meals out.   I went through an unwilling ‘recovery’ where I was deeply confused. I had all of the same anxieties associated with food, but I believed I should be eating like my peers. I got fat and was just as anxious about food.
